8565314250.text: @mroesch Then maybe Snort should add a scanner. For alerts, users could choose [ignore], [block], or [fight back] :)

8558355873.text: Nmap stars in another movie: Girl With the Dragon Tattoo! Pics & trailer: http://nmap.org/movies.html#gwtdt

8294263024.text: Nmap 5.21 released with zero exciting new features! But this bugfix-only release should be extra stable. http://bit.ly/nmap521

7994986721.text: Released Nmap 5.20, our first stable since last July! Better performance, 31 new NSE scripts, and more. http://bit.ly/nmap520

7014455932.text: In lieu of a Christmas card, we're giving you a new Nmap release - 5.10BETA2! Xmas scan is -sX. http://bit.ly/nmapxmas

5984662403.text: Version 5.10BETA1 released with 100+ improvements, including 14 new NSE scripts and better UDP scan! http://bit.ly/510B1

5182940435.text: We won't stop tweeting, but you can now get Nmap news on Facebook too! http://nmap.org/fb

5105974077.text: For the first year ever, all of our Google Summer of Code students passed! Wrap-up report: http://bit.ly/nmapsoc09

5055354139.text: Congratulations to @metasploit and @hdmoore on joining @rapid7! My take: http://bit.ly/msploit

4872365257.text: Just relaunched http://seclists.org with new features, 8 new lists, & picture of @daveaitel! http://bit.ly/newseclists

3825547383.text: Yay, we're back online! Just in time for a lazy Labor Day afternoon of BBQ and port scanning.

3808846928.text: Sorry for the down time. We suffered a hard drive failure on our main server and are working on recovery+upgrade now.

2920242262.text: If zf05.txt didn't scare you into choosing strong SSH passwords, this might: http://bit.ly/ncrack-ssh

2918273514.text: Can't wait for #Defcon! We're having a developer meet-up, and also a book signing Friday: http://bit.ly/nns-dc

2675109777.text: I'm glad UCSD is mirroring this release on gigabit link, as Nmap 5 just made Slashdot: http://bit.ly/nmap5-sd

2674926755.text: Nmap5 news/reviews are starting to roll in: http://nmap.org/5/#articles

2671912942.text: Just made our biggest release since 1997! Nmap 5.00: http://nmap.org/5/

2333998470.text: Planning 1st stable release in 9 months. Just posted release candidate 4.90RC1. Please help test! http://nmap.org/download.html

2123996455.text: We're seeking help translating Nmap and its documentation to your favorite language: http://bit.ly/xlate

2123991696.text: After months of hard work, Open Source Press just published a German translation of Nmap Network Scanning: http://bit.ly/nns-de

2123978780.text: Just added German and Indonesian translations of the Nmap Reference Guide. Choose from 16 languages at http://nmap.org/docs.html

1888566330.text: @Viss - thanks! It gets even better if you use -A instead of --script. I also add -T4 for speed and sometimes -v too.

1888118380.text: Added a great NSE script in SVN for detecting the IIS WebDAV vuln. See http://tinyurl.com/hack-iis & http://tinyurl.com/sksec

1789195485.text: @geekgrrl Good idea! We're updating & expanding http://sectools.org this year, and I've added that to the feature list.

1788153914.text: Nmap 4.85BETA9 released with dozens of improvements: http://tinyurl.com/485beta9

1720885575.text: Introducing the 2009 Nmap/Google Summer of Code Team: http://tinyurl.com/nmapgsoc09

1662332038.text: We helped contain the Conficker virus last month and are now working on an NSE script to detect swine flu :)

1643078442.text: @daveaitel So do you think we should write Ncrack in Python like Canvas (and Zenmap) rather than C?

1642796010.text: We're writing a high-speed network authentication cracker! Ncrack: http://tinyurl.com/dzjxav

1579105267.text: Version 4.85BETA8 just released with dozens of improvements: http://tinyurl.com/485BETA8

1579091680.text: Latest Conficker (D/E) variant blocks nmap.* and insecure.* sites. We take that as a compliment--our work pissed them off!

1449412883.text: Nmap 4.85BETA7, the third release in a very busy week, is now available & survived 2 days of testing. http://bit.ly/cYz6Y

1449352894.text: Prereg for @toorcamp extended until Sunday and wow it looks fun! Like Defcon and Burning Man combined at a missile silo. http://toorcamp.org

1428155873.text: 4.85BETA6 released and graciously hosted by UCSD. Details at http://insecure.org.

1427479032.text: Booted off Dreamhost "unlimited bandwidth" plan for using too much bandwidth. Nmap available again on diff server,but 4.85BETA6 coming soon.

1422882163.text: @hdmoore You mean MS08-067 check? We disable it by default too. Conficker check is simple & unlikely to crash, but no guarantees w/Windows!

1420425735.text: Nmap project accepted for fifth year of Summer of Code. Seeking talented college/grad students! Paid by Google. See http://nmap.org/soc/

1420404053.text: Nmap 4.85BETA5 released with Conficker worm detection ability!  http://insecure.org/#conficker

1308561971.text: Nmap discovered in 8th movie! Russian teenager hacks Microsoft.com, so MS sends sexy hacker girl after him. http://nmap.org/movies.html

1308539491.text: Nmap wins LQ Network Security App of the Year Award—for sixth year in a row! http://tinyurl.com/at36p9

1308535278.text: The old Twitter "nmap" account was apparently renamed or deleted, so I pounced on it! @nmapster is no more.

1163266242.text: Contracts signed for NNS translations to German, Korean, and Portuguese: http://nmap.org/book/#translations. More on the way, I hope.

1163265203.text: My CanSecWest talk on Ninja Scanning was accepted. I love that con and attended/presented all 9 previous years. http://cansecwest.com

1163254008.text: Yay, NNS launch was a success! #1 selling computer book on Amazon (briefly). Took screenshot: http://tinyurl.com/nns-top

1047898597.text: I just released my new book, Nmap Network Scanning! Reviews and sample chapters: http://nmap.org/book/. Amazon: http://tinyurl.com/nnsbook

962945193.text: Congratulations to six Nmap/Google Summer of Code students!  http://tinyurl.com/4b6v8p

943089976.text: Nmap 4.75 and 4.76 can now draw pretty network graphs: http://tinyurl.com/5bqt4m

909012768.text: I don't tweet much. For updates, see my sites instead: http://insecure.org, http://nmap.org, http://seclists.org, http://sectools.org
